FuncDef:
The ds-lite reverse-session-limit command enables the limitation on the maximum number of network-to-user DS-Lite sessions, or configures the maximum number of network-to-user DS-Lite sessions.
The undo ds-lite reverse-session-limit command disables the limitation on the maximum number of network-to-user DS-Lite sessions, or restores the default upper limit.

By default, the user-based DS-Lite session number limitation is enabled. The maximum number of user-to-network DS-Lite sessions for each user of a specific or all three protocols is as follows:

TCP or UDP: 10240

ICMP: 512

TCP, UDP, and ICMP: 8192



If the total parameter is set, this parameter takes precedence.
CLIs: ds-lite reverse-session-limit { enable | icmp <session-number> | tcp <session-number> | total <session-number> | udp <session-number> }
undo ds-lite reverse-session-limit { enable | { icmp | tcp | total | udp } [ <session-number> ] }

ParaDef.Info:
Enables the limitation on the maximum number of network-to-user DS-Lite sessions.
-

Indicates the maximum number of ICMP network-to-user DS-Lite sessions for each user.
The value is an integer ranging from 50 to 65535.

Indicates the maximum number of TCP network-to-user DS-Lite sessions for each user.
The value is an integer ranging from 50 to 65535.

Indicates the maximum number of total network-to-user DS-Lite sessions for each user.If the total number of TCP, UDP, and ICMP network-to-user IP sessions for each user reaches the maximum number, DS-Lite cannot be performed even if the number of TCP, UDP, or ICMP network-to-user IP sessions for each user has not reached the maximum number.
The value is an integer ranging from 50 to 65535.

Indicates the maximum number of UDP network-to-user DS-Lite sessions for each user.
The value is an integer ranging from 50 to 65535.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the ds-lite reverse-session-limit enable command is run in the DS-Lite instance view, the system will allow the creation of only a specified number of network-to-user DS-Lite sessions.
A reverse session is established for packets transmitted from the network side to the user side.
Some unauthorized users may consume a lot of session resources to attack devices. As a result, there is a possibility that no session can be used by authorized users for DS-Lite. To prevent this, run the ds-lite session-limit command to limit the number of sessions that can be used.
Prerequisites
The configured maximum number of network-to-user DS-Lite sessions that can be established can take effect only after the ds-lite reverse-session-limit enable command is run.
Configuration Impact
After the number of network-to-user DS-Lite sessions established for a specific user reaches the upper limit, no more sessions can be established for the user. After existing DS-Lite sessions age and the number of established network-to-user DS-Lite sessions falls below the upper limit, new sessions can be established for the user.
